Yeah here's the thing.  I have a netbook.  No CD drive and I don't have a jump drive big enough for Ubuntu.  I just tried unetbootin but the harddrive was mounted (cause that's how it works.  And I couldn't install Ubuntu.
wait, what do you mean the harddrive was mounted? i assume you copied the CD to a USB stick using unetbootin, and then booted from it?
No man.  You can use unetbootin to boot an ISO on the harddrive of the machine.
If I could put Ubuntu on a live USB I'd do that.  I don't have a stick big enough.
uhm, again though, you only really need a ~10mb stick for minimal.
Anyway, what happens is Ubuntu thinks the HDD is the cd (since it is a live CD iso) and it thinks it's mounted so it won't repartition the drive.
of course you don't have all the fancy graphics of the live installer... but it always worked just fine for me. although if you don't have wired ethernet, i guess that might be problematic.
